verses.text: My \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, \w attend|strong="H7181"\w* unto my \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, \add and\add* \w bow|strong="H5186"\w* thine \w ear|strong="H0241"\w* to my \w understanding|strong="H8394"\w*:
That thou mayest \w regard|strong="H8104"\w* \w discretion|strong="H4209"\w*, and \add that\add* thy \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* may \w keep|strong="H5341"\w* \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*.

¶ For the \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* of a strange \w woman|strong="H2114"\w* \w drop|strong="H5197"\w* \add as\add* an \w honeycomb|strong="H5317"\w*, and her \w mouth|strong="H2441"\w* \add is\add* \w smoother|strong="H2509"\w* than \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*:\f + \fr 5.3 \ft mouth: Heb. palate\f*
But her \w end|strong="H0319"\w* is \w bitter|strong="H4751"\w* as \w wormwood|strong="H3939"\w*, \w sharp|strong="H2299"\w* as a \w twoedged|strong="H6310"\w* \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*.
Her \w feet|strong="H7272"\w* go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to \w death|strong="H4194"\w*; her \w steps|strong="H6806"\w* take \w hold|strong="H8551"\w* on \w hell|strong="H7585"\w*.

Lest thou shouldest \w ponder|strong="H6424"\w* the \w path|strong="H0734"\w* of \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, her \w ways|strong="H4570"\w* are \w moveable|strong="H5128"\w*, \add that\add* thou canst not \w know|strong="H3045"\w* \add them\add*.
\w Hear|strong="H8085"\w* me now therefore, O ye \w children|strong="H1121"\w*, and \w depart|strong="H5493"\w* not from the \w words|strong="H0561"\w* of my \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*.
\w Remove|strong="H7368"\w* thy \w way|strong="H1870"\w* \w far|strong="H7368"\w* from her, and come not \w nigh|strong="H7126"\w* the \w door|strong="H6607"\w* of her \w house|strong="H1004"\w*:
Lest thou \w give|strong="H5414"\w* thine \w honour|strong="H1935"\w* unto \w others|strong="H0312"\w*, and thy \w years|strong="H8141"\w* unto the \w cruel|strong="H0394"\w*:

Lest \w strangers|strong="H2114"\w* be \w filled|strong="H7646"\w* with thy \w wealth|strong="H3581"\w*; and thy \w labours|strong="H6089"\w* \add be\add* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of a \w stranger|strong="H5237"\w*;\f + \fr 5.10 \ft thy wealth: Heb. thy strength\f*
And thou \w mourn|strong="H5098"\w* at the \w last|strong="H0319"\w*, when thy \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w* and thy \w body|strong="H7607"\w* are \w consumed|strong="H3615"\w*,
And \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, How have I \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* \w instruction|strong="H4148"\w*, and my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w despised|strong="H5006"\w* \w reproof|strong="H8433"\w*;

And have not \w obeyed|strong="H8085"\w* the \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* of my \w teachers|strong="H3384"\w*, nor \w inclined|strong="H5186"\w* mine \w ear|strong="H0241"\w* to them that \w instructed|strong="H3925"\w* me!
I was \w almost|strong="H4592"\w* in all \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w congregation|strong="H6951"\w* and \w assembly|strong="H5712"\w*.

¶ \w Drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* out of thine own \w cistern|strong="H0953"\w*, and running \w waters|strong="H5140"\w* out \w of|strong="H8432"\w* thine own \w well|strong="H0875"\w*.

Let thy \w fountains|strong="H4599"\w* be \w dispersed|strong="H6327"\w* \w abroad|strong="H2351"\w*, \add and\add* \w rivers|strong="H6388"\w* of \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* in the \w streets|strong="H7339"\w*.
Let them be only thine own, and not \w strangers’|strong="H2114"\w* with thee.
Let thy \w fountain|strong="H4726"\w* be \w blessed|strong="H1288"\w*: and \w rejoice|strong="H8055"\w* with the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of thy \w youth|strong="H5271"\w*.

\add Let her be as\add* the \w loving|strong="H0158"\w* \w hind|strong="H0365"\w* and \w pleasant|strong="H2580"\w* \w roe|strong="H3280"\w*; let her \w breasts|strong="H1717"\w* \w satisfy|strong="H7301"\w* thee at all \w times|strong="H6256"\w*; and be thou \w ravished|strong="H7686"\w* \w always|strong="H8548"\w* with her \w love|strong="H0160"\w*.\f + \fr 5.19 \ft satisfy…: Heb. water thee\f*\f + \fr 5.19 \ft be thou…: Heb. err thou always in her love\f*

And why wilt thou, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, be \w ravished|strong="H7686"\w* with a strange \w woman|strong="H2114"\w*, and \w embrace|strong="H2263"\w* the \w bosom|strong="H2436"\w* of a \w stranger|strong="H5237"\w*?

For the \w ways|strong="H1870"\w* of \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add are\add* \w before|strong="H5227"\w* the \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and he \w pondereth|strong="H6424"\w* all his \w goings|strong="H4570"\w*.

¶ His own \w iniquities|strong="H5771"\w* shall \w take|strong="H3920"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* himself, and he shall be \w holden|strong="H8551"\w* with the \w cords|strong="H2256"\w* of his \w sins|strong="H2403"\w*.\f + \fr 5.22 \ft sins: Heb. sin\f*
He shall \w die|strong="H4191"\w* without \w instruction|strong="H4148"\w*; and in the \w greatness|strong="H7230"\w* of his \w folly|strong="H0200"\w* he shall go \w astray|strong="H7686"\w*.
